Subject: A Tale of Two Sinclairs
Description: The early “personal computer revolution” in the UK was influenced by two models of personal computers, the ZX-81 / Timex-Sinclair 1000 (mentioned in context with the ZX-80) and the QL. Gaming was profoundly influenced by the ZX Spectrum, the important successor to the ZX-81. We’ll talk about their general architecture, software and hardware, as they provide insights into the history of Sinclair Computers (a major UK computer company of the 1980’s), and how both the computer industry and it’s market were rapidly changing in that era – with lessons for today. Both computers will be discussed in technical detail and put into historic context.  Speakers include:Adam Trent Phillips - Track: Tech  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector
